intro: Glehnia littoralis, commonly known as the sea blush or sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the northern hemisphere. It is characterized by its silver-green, fuzzy leaves and striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant thrives in saline and sandy soils, often found in dunes and tidal zones. Its structure is adapted to withstand coastal winds and salt spray, making it a hardy species. Glehnia littoralis plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems and providing habitat for various insects.
